metadata.title: How to manage the post pandemic opening? A Pontryagin Maximum Principle approach

abstract.text: The COVID-19 pandemic has completely disrupted the operation of our societies. Its elusive transmission process, characterized by an unusually long incubation period, as well as a high contagion capacity, has forced many countries to take quarantine and social isolation measures that conspire against the performance of national economies.

This situation confronts decision makers in different countries with the alternative of reopening the economies, thus facing the unpredictable cost of a rebound of the infection. This work tries to offer an initial theoretical framework to handle this alternative.

body_text.text: After several months of quarantine and social isolation, the national governments of the different countries face the inevitable decision to reactivate their economies. This decision is accompanied by the almost certain rebound of the epidemic, since, in the absence of social isolation, the number of infections will surely skyrocket again. In the execution of this process there are two completely clear extremes:
body_text.section: Introduction.

body_text.text: a) A restart of economic activities in all their extent will cause a strong rebound of the epidemic with the expected death of many human beings. b) Continuing for a long period of time the quarantine will result in an economic contraction with unpredictable consequences.
body_text.section: Introduction.

body_text.text: Therefore, the restart of the economies and the rebound of the epidemic are in essence two contradictory force and the search for a strategy that tries to optimally manage the unwanted effects is necessary.
body_text.section: Introduction.

body_text.text: In the pages that follow, a functional is constructed, subject to certain dynamic restrictions that aim to capture the basic aspects of the process of economic restart under the preexistence of the epidemic. The method used to solve the problem has been the Pontryaguin Maximum Principle. Once the conditions that this principle prescribes have been established, a system of ordinary differential equations (7) and an equation for the control (6) are obtained that allow to maximize the economic performance subject to the restrictions imposed by the contagion. Conditions to avoid the rebound of the epidemic are also analyzed in the text..

body_text.text: ( ): Number of asymptomatic people in the instant of time belonging to the age range that make up the economically active population, but with an age less than or equal to which are allowed to go out to work. The parameter τ may be varied by decision makers as the epidemiological situation changes. The idea of initially restricting through age to people who are allowed to go out to work is due to the virus's well-known characteristic of being more severe with the elderly. Note that this group contains the susceptible, latent, (that is, when the individual has been infected, but does not yet show symptoms or is not still capable of infecting) and asymptomatic infectious, all of them of age less than or equal to . body_text.text: One of the possible causes of a rebound of the epidemic is the existence of isolated quasi-periodic or periodic solutions asymptotically stable of the system (8). Under the hypothesis that system (8) has periodic solutions, a condition at least necessary to avoid epidemic rebound is that one of the Lyapunov exponent of the aforementioned solutions be positive. The Lyapunov exponents in most cases must be calculated numerically and the algorithms are generally large CPU time consumers.
body_text.section: Definition of variables and problem statement.

body_text.text: Conclusions.
body_text.section: Definition of variables and problem statement.

body_text.text: In this work, a minimal theoretical framework has been developed to guide decision makers from different governments in a reopening of the economy. Equation (6) and system (7) provide the necessary information for this. Functional (1) captures the essential ingredients for this process. Obviously, a refinement of it and the system (2) could provide more precise results.
